metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2730 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.19.1, as used in MozillaFirefox before 39.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.8 and 38.x before 38.1, andother products, does not properly perform Elliptical Curve Cryptography(ECC) multiplications, which makes it easier for remote attackers to spoofECDSA signatures via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.19.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.19.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.19.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.19.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
